eng_def: something bad that happens that is not expected or intended and that often damages something or injures someone
eng_sen: Josh had an accident and spilled water all over his work.
She was injured in a car/road accident (= when one car hit another).
chi_sen: 喬希不小心把作業上灑得都是水。
她在一宗車禍／交通意外中受傷了。

eng_def: a small thin piece of metal with a point at one end, especially used for temporarily holding pieces of cloth together
chi_def: （尤指用於固定布料用的）別針，大頭針
eng_sen: I'll keep the trouser patch in place with pins while I sew it on.
chi_sen: 在把褲子的補丁縫上去時，我會用別針把它固定好。

eng_def: a thin piece of metal
eng_sen: If you pull the pin out of a hand-grenade, it'll explode.
a two-pin/three-pin electrical plug
Doctors inserted a metal pin in his leg to hold the bones together.
chi_sen: 拉掉手榴彈上的保險栓它就會爆炸。
那是雙腳插頭還是三腳插頭？
醫生把一根鋼針釘進他腿裡，把骨頭固定好。

eng_def: a decorative object, used as jewellery
eng_sen: a hat/tie pin
chi_sen: 女帽飾針／領帶別針

eng_def: a leg
eng_sen: Grandpa's very old now and he's very shaky on his pins.
chi_sen: 爺爺現在年紀很大了，走路有點不穩。

eng_def: In the game of chess, a pin is a special move that stops the other player from moving one of their pieces, because to move it will put another more valuable piece in danger.
chi_def: 牽制，困子（西洋棋中「牽制」或「困子」是特殊的一步，移動後可阻止另一方移動某棋子，因為移動該棋子會使另一個更重要的棋子有危險）
eng_sen: That nasty pin stopped me from moving my knight.
chi_sen: 這步討厭的牽制，使我無法移動我的馬。

eng_def: to fasten something with a pin
eng_sen: A large picture of the president was pinned to/(up) on the office wall.
She had pinned up her beautiful long hair.
chi_sen: 總統的巨幅照片釘在辦公室的牆上。
她把美麗的長髮用髮夾別了起來。

eng_def: to force someone or something to stay in a particular place by putting weight on him, her, or it
eng_sen: She was pinned (down) under a pile of rubble.
A guy leaped out at me and pinned me (up) against the wall.
chi_sen: 她被壓在一堆碎石下面。
一個傢夥向我撲過來，把我按在牆上。

eng_def: a tube inside which liquid or gas flows from one place to another
eng_sen: a water/gas/sewer pipe
a burst/fractured/leaking pipe
chi_sen: 供水管道／煤氣管道／污水管
爆裂／破裂／外洩的管道

eng_def: a short, narrow tube with a small container at one end, used for smoking tobacco
eng_sen: I ordered some tea for myself and lit my pipe.
chi_sen: 我叫了茶，點著了煙斗。

eng_def: to transport something in a pipe
eng_sen: Hot water is piped to all apartments from the central boiler room.
Music is piped throughout the hotel complex.
chi_sen: 熱水從中央鍋爐房經管道輸送到每個公寓套房。
音樂聲在整棟飯店大樓裡迴盪。

eng_def: a set of decisions about how to do something in the future
eng_sen: a company's business plan
a negotiated peace plan
a five-year plan
holiday plans
What are your plans for this weekend?
My plan is to sell the house and buy an apartment.
chi_sen: 公司的商業計劃
談判達成的和平方案
五年計劃
假期安排
這個週末你有甚麼計劃？
我的計畫是賣了這棟房子再買一間公寓。

eng_def: a type of arrangement for financial investment
eng_sen: a pension/savings plan
chi_sen: 退休金／儲蓄方案

eng_def: to happen in the way you intend:
chi_def: 這類事件很少會按計劃發展。
eng_sen: Events of this type rarely go according to plan.
chi_sen: 這類事件很少會按計劃發展。

eng_def: a drawing of a building, town, area, vehicle, machine, etc. that only shows its shape from above, its size, and the position of important details
eng_sen: a street plan (= a type of map of a town showing the roads)
a seating plan (= a drawing that shows where each person will sit)
chi_sen: 街道平面圖
座位表

eng_def: drawings from which something is made or built:
chi_def: 建築師向我們展示了她畫的房屋詳圖。
eng_sen: The architect showed us the house plans that she had drawn up.
chi_sen: 建築師向我們展示了她畫的房屋詳圖。

eng_def: to think about and decide what you are going to do or how you are going to do something
eng_sen: She helped them to plan their route.
If we plan carefully, we should be able to stay within our budget.
She's already planning how to spend her prize money.
chi_sen: 她幫助他們設計路線。
如果我們精打細算，我們就可以不超支。
她已經在計劃如何花獎金了。

eng_def: to intend to do something or that an event or result should happen
eng_sen: Our meeting wasn't planned - it was completely accidental.
I'm not planning to stay here much longer.
We only planned for six guests, but then someone brought a friend.
chi_sen: 我們的會面不是安排好的——純屬偶然。
我不打算在這裡再待很長時間。
我們本來預計只有六個客人來訪，但有人帶了一個朋友來。

eng_def: to design a building or structure
eng_sen: The people who planned these new towns had a vision of clean modern housing for everyone.
chi_sen: 新城鎮的設計者期望為所有人提供整潔的現代居所。

eng_def: a living thing that grows in earth, in water, or on other plants, usually has a stem, leaves, roots, and flowers, and produces seeds
eng_sen: native plants and animals
garden/greenhouse/indoor plants
a tomato plant
chi_sen: 原產於當地的動植物
花園／溫室／室內植物
一株番茄

eng_def: machines used in industry
eng_sen: The industry was accused of having invested little in workers, plant, or infrastructure.
chi_sen: 工業界被指責在工人、工廠和基礎設施方面投入太少。

eng_def: a factory in which a particular product is made or power is produced
eng_sen: Two more car-assembly plants were closed by the strike.
chi_sen: 又有兩家汽車裝配廠因罷工而關閉。

eng_def: a large, heavy machine or vehicle used in industry, for building roads, etc.
chi_def: （用於修路等的重型）設備，裝置，機械
eng_sen: The sign by the roadworks said "Slow - heavy plant crossing".
The firm's main business was plant hire.
chi_sen: 道路工程旁邊的告示牌上寫著「減速——前方有重型施工機械」。
這家公司的主要業務是設備租賃。

eng_def: something illegal or stolen that has been put secretly in a person's clothing or among the things that belong to them to make them seem guilty of a crime
eng_sen: He insisted the money was a plant.
chi_sen: 他堅持說錢是被人栽贓嫁禍。

eng_def: to put a plant into the ground or into a container of soil so that it will grow
eng_sen: We planted trees and bushes in our new garden.
Hyacinth bulbs planted in pots now will flower early in the spring.
chi_sen: 我們在新花園裡種了樹和灌木。
如果現在種在花盆裡，風信子的球莖會在早春開花。

eng_def: If you plant a particular area, you put plants into the ground there.
eng_sen: The plot was surrounded by a stone wall and planted with flowering trees.
a densely planted garden (= one in which the plants are close together)
chi_sen: 那個地方圍著石牆，種著繁花盛開的樹。
花木茂密的花園

eng_def: to put something firmly and strongly in a particular place
eng_sen: My brother planted himself on the sofa in front of the television.
He planted a kiss on her forehead/a blow on his opponent's jaw.
chi_sen: 我哥哥坐在電視機前的沙發上。
他在她的額頭上吻了一下／一拳打在對手的下巴上。

eng_def: to cause an idea or story to exist
eng_sen: That incident planted doubts about him in my mind.
Who planted these rumours?
chi_sen: 那件事讓我對他產生了懷疑。
誰製造了這些謠言？

eng_def: to put something or someone in a position secretly, especially in order to deceive someone
eng_sen: She insisted that the drugs had been planted on her without her knowledge.
chi_sen: 她堅持說毒品是在她毫不知曉的情況下有人栽贓於她的。

eng_def: to put a bomb somewhere so that it will explode there
eng_sen: The bomb was planted in the station waiting room.
chi_sen: 炸彈被放置在車站的候車室內。

eng_def: When you play, especially as a child, you spend time doing an enjoyable and/or entertaining activity.
eng_sen: The children spent the afternoon playing with their new toys.
My daughter used to play with the kids next door.
chi_sen: 孩子們下午在玩自己的新玩具。
我女兒以前常跟隔壁的孩子們玩。

eng_def: to take part in a game or other organized activity
eng_sen: Do you want to play cards/football (with us)?
Irene won't be able to play in the tennis match on Saturday.
Which team do you play for?
Luke plays centre-forward (= plays in that position within the team).
chi_sen: 你想（和我們）打牌／踢球嗎？
愛琳星期六不能參加網球比賽。
你效力於哪支球隊？
盧克踢中鋒。

eng_def: to compete against a person or team in a game
eng_sen: Who are the Giants playing next week?
chi_sen: 下星期巨人隊和哪支隊伍比賽？

eng_def: to hit or kick a ball in a game
eng_sen: He played the ball back to the goalkeeper.
A good pool player takes time deciding which shot to play.
chi_sen: 他把球踢回給守門員。
一個優秀的檯球選手會從容考慮擊哪顆球。

eng_def: (in a card game) to choose a card from the ones you are holding and put it down on the table
eng_sen: She played the ace of spades.
chi_sen: 她出了一張黑桃 A。

eng_def: to perform an entertainment or a particular character in a play, film, etc.
eng_sen: Scottish Opera played to full houses every night.
I didn't realize that "Macbeth" was playing (= being performed) at the festival.
In the movie version, Branagh played the hero.
chi_sen: 蘇格蘭歌劇院每晚演出都爆滿。
我沒想到《馬克白》正在藝術節上演。
在電影版中，布拉那扮演主人公。

eng_def: to behave or pretend in a particular way, especially in order to produce a particular effect or result
eng_sen: to play dead/dumb
Would you mind playing host (= entertaining the guests)?
chi_sen: 裝死／啞巴
你來招待客人好嗎？

eng_def: to deceive someone to make them laugh or in order to get an advantage over them
eng_sen: She loves playing practical jokes on her friends.
chi_sen: 她喜歡對她的朋友們惡作劇。

eng_def: to help to achieve something
eng_sen: My thanks to everyone who has played a part in saving the hospital.
chi_sen: 我向參與拯救這家醫院的每一個人表示感謝。

eng_def: to perform music on an instrument or instruments
chi_def: 演奏，彈撥，吹奏（樂器）;播放
eng_sen: He learned to play the clarinet at the age of ten.
Play us a song!/Play a song for us!
On Radio London they play African and South American music as well as rock and pop.
They could hear a jazz band playing in the distance.
chi_sen: 他十歲就開始學習吹奏單簧管。
給我們奏支曲子吧！
倫敦廣播電台不僅播放搖滾和流行音樂，還播放非洲和南美洲的音樂。
他們可以聽到遠處的爵士樂隊在演奏。

eng_def: to (cause a machine to) produce sound or a picture
eng_sen: Play the last few minutes of the video again.
chi_sen: 把錄影帶的最後幾分鐘再放一遍。

eng_def: to direct or be directed over or onto something
eng_sen: Firefighters played their hoses onto the base of the fire.
A fountain was playing (= sending out water) in the courtyard outside.
chi_sen: 消防隊員把水龍頭對準火源。
外面院子裡有個噴泉在噴水。

eng_def: (of something you see, such as light) to move quickly or be seen for a short time
eng_sen: A smile played across/over/on his lips.
chi_sen: 他的唇角閃過一絲微笑。

eng_def: to risk money, especially on the results of races or business deals, hoping to win more money
eng_sen: He plays the horses/the stock market.
chi_sen: 他玩賭馬／炒股。

eng_def: a piece of writing that is intended to be acted in a theatre or on radio or television
eng_sen: a radio play
"Did you see the play (= the performance of the play) on Thursday?" "No, I went on Wednesday night."
chi_sen: 廣播劇
「你是星期四去看的那齣戲嗎？」「不，我星期三去的。」

eng_def: the activity of taking part in a sport or a game
eng_sen: Rain stopped play during the final of the National Tennis Championship.
chi_sen: 下雨使全國網球錦標賽的決賽中斷了。

eng_def: a plan or a small set of actions in a sport
eng_sen: The new pitcher made a great play on that throw to first base.
chi_sen: 新投手向一壘投出了精彩的一球。

eng_def: activity that is not serious but done for enjoyment, especially when children enjoy themselves with toys and games
eng_sen: The kids don't get much time for play in the evenings.
We watched the children at play in the park.
chi_sen: 孩子們晚上沒有多少時間玩。
我們看著公園裡玩耍的孩子們。

eng_def: movement
eng_sen: the play of moonlight across the water
the play of emotion across/on his face
chi_sen: 水面上月光閃爍
他面部表情的變化

eng_def: the fact that a rope or a structure is free to move, especially a small distance
chi_def: （尤指小幅度的）伸縮餘地；間隙；活動空間
eng_sen: Aircraft wings are designed to have a certain amount of play in them.
chi_sen: 飛機的機翼設計得有一定的彈性空間。

eng_def: used to make a request more polite
chi_def: 好嗎，請（用於客氣地請求）
eng_sen: Could I have two coffees and a tea, please?
Please remember to close the windows before you leave.
chi_sen: 給我來兩杯咖啡、一杯茶好嗎？
您離開前請記住關上窗戶。

eng_def: used to add force to a request or demand
chi_def: 請，求求你（用於加強請求或要求的語氣）
eng_sen: Please, David, put the knife down.
Oh, please. Do shut up!
chi_sen: 求求你，大衛，把刀放下。
好了，別說了！

eng_def: used especially by children to a teacher or other adult in order to get their attention
chi_def: 讓我說（尤指兒童為引起老師或其他成年人的注意時的用語）
eng_sen: Please, Miss, I know the answer!
chi_sen: 我來說，老師，我知道答案！

eng_def: used when accepting something politely or enthusiastically
chi_def: 好，謝謝（用於禮貌或熱情地接受某物時）
eng_sen: "More potatoes?" "Please."
"May I bring my husband?" "Please do."
"Would you like dessert?" "Oh, yes please."
chi_sen: 「要不要再來點馬鈴薯？」「好的。」
「我可以帶我丈夫來嗎？」「當然可以。」
「你要甜品嗎？」「啊，太好了。」

eng_def: to make someone feel happy or satisfied, or to give someone pleasure
eng_sen: I only got married to please my parents.
He was always a good boy, very friendly and eager to please.
It always pleases me to see a well-designed book!
chi_sen: 我結婚只是為了讓我父母高興。
他一直是個好孩子，對人非常友好，容易相處。。
看到一本設計精美的書，我總是很開心。

eng_def: to want, like, or choose, when used with words such as "whatever", "whoever", and "anywhere"
chi_def: 願意，樂意（與 whatever， whoever 和 anywhere 等詞連用）
eng_sen: She thinks she can just do whatever/as she pleases.
I shall go out with whoever I please.
chi_sen: 她覺得自己可以為所欲為。
我想和誰出去就和誰出去。

eng_def: used to express surprise and anger:
chi_def: 光換幾扇打破的窗戶他們竟然要200英鎊！
eng_sen: They want £200, if you please, just to replace a couple of broken windows!
chi_sen: 光換幾扇打破的窗戶他們竟然要200英鎊！

eng_def: used to make a request more polite:
eng_sen: Take your seats, ladies and gentlemen, if you please.
chi_sen: 女士們先生們，請坐。

eng_def: used when referring to a time in the afternoon or evening or at night
eng_sen: We'll be arriving at about 4.30 p.m.
The 6 p.m. train is usually very crowded.
chi_sen: 我們下午4：30左右到。
下午六點的火車通常很擠。

eng_def:
abbreviation for
prime minister
eng_sen: The PM wants to see you.
chi_sen: 首相想見你。

eng_def:
abbreviation for 
project manager
chi_def: 項目經理（project manager 的縮寫）
eng_sen: Who's PM on this project?
chi_sen: 誰是這個項目的經理？

eng_def: abbreviation for private message: a message sent on a social media website that only the person it is sent to can see
eng_sen: I sent you a PM yesterday. Did you get it?
chi_sen: 我昨天給你發了一條私信，你收到了嗎？

eng_def: abbreviation for private message: to send someone a private message on a social media website
eng_sen: PM me if you have any questions.
chi_sen: 有問題的話，私信我。

eng_def: an idea, opinion, or piece of information that is said or written
eng_sen: I'd like to discuss the first point in your essay.
You made some interesting points in your speech.
chi_sen: 我想討論一下你文章中的第一點。
你發言中有些觀點很有趣。

eng_def: the meaning or most important part of what someone says or writes
eng_sen: The point is, if you don't claim the money now you might never get it.
I think you missed (= did not understand) the point of what she was saying.
I take your point/Point taken (= I understand that what you are saying is important).
Please get to the point (= say the thing that is most important to you).
He hasn't got much money, but that's not the point (= that is not the important thing).
chi_sen: 重要的是，如果你現在不索取這筆錢的話，你可能就再也得不到了。
我認為你沒有理解她說的要點。
我明白你的意思。
請言歸正轉。
他沒有多少錢，但這不是重點。

eng_def: an opinion or fact that deserves to be considered seriously, or that other people agree is true
eng_sen: Yes, I can see your point/you've got a point there.
OK, you've made your point (= told us your opinion) - there's no need to go on about it.
chi_sen: 是的，我明白你的意思／你說得有道理。
好，你已經表明了你的觀點，沒必要再多說了。

eng_def: not important or not related to the subject being discussed
chi_def: 不重要的；離題的，不相關的
eng_sen: The fact that he doesn't want to come is beside the point - he should have been invited.
chi_sen: 他不想來這並不重要——重要的是他本來應該受邀請的。

eng_def: said to show that what someone has just said is true or important
eng_sen: "We'll take the bus." "But we don't have any money for the fare." "That's a point."
chi_sen: 「我們乘公共汽車吧。」「但我們沒錢買車票。」「這倒是。」

eng_def: a particular time or stage reached in a process
eng_sen: At that point, a soldier opened fire on the car.
I was completely lost at one point.
It was so confusing that eventually it got to the point where no one knew what was going on.
I said I'd tell her the bad news, but when it came to the point (= when I had to do it), I couldn't.
chi_sen: 就在此時，一個士兵向轎車開了火。
我一度完全不知所措了。
這件事很莫名其妙，最後無人知道到底發生了甚麼事。
我說過我要告訴她這個壞消息，但真要開口的時候，我卻說不出口了。

eng_def: a particular place
eng_sen: the point where the road bends
This is a good point from which to watch the race.
chi_sen: 公路拐彎處
這是個觀看比賽的好地方。

eng_def: purpose or usefulness
eng_sen: There's no point arguing about it - we're going and that's that.
I'd like to write to him, but what's the point? He never writes back.
I see little point in discussing this further.
chi_sen: 爭辯也沒有用——我們要去，就這麼定了。
我願意寫信給他，但這有甚麼用呢？他從不回信。
我看不出繼續討論還有甚麼意義。

eng_def: a mark or unit for counting, especially how much a person or team has scored in a sport
eng_sen: The youngest skier won the most points.
He won the world heavyweight boxing championship on points (= as a result of the points that he had won).
Interest rates have risen by two percentage points (= two percent).
chi_sen: 那個最年輕的滑雪選手得分最高。
他以點數贏得了世界重量級拳擊冠軍。
利率上漲了兩個百分點。

eng_def: a unit used for measuring the size of printed letters, equal to about 0.3 mm or 1/72 of an inch
chi_def: 點，磅值（印刷字型大小的計量單位，約等於0.3毫米）
eng_sen: The large letters are in 7.5 point type, and the small letters are in 6 point.
chi_sen: 大的字母是7½點的，小的是6點的。

eng_def: the sharp end of something, such as a knife
eng_sen: The knife landed with its point sticking into the floor.
Be careful with that needle - it has a very sharp point.
chi_sen: 刀落地時刀尖刺入了地面。
小心針，它的頭很尖。

eng_def: a particular quality or characteristic of a person or thing
eng_sen: There are various points to look out for when you're judging dogs in a competition.
He's boring, but I suppose he has his good points.
I think her kindness is one of her strong points (= one of her good qualities).
chi_sen: 在比賽中要根據各方面的特點對狗作出評比。
他很乏味，但我認為他也有長處。
我覺得為人和氣是她的優點之一。

eng_def: a long, thin area of land that stretches out into the sea
eng_sen: Spurn Point
chi_sen: 斯珀恩角

eng_def: a small, round spot that is used in numbers to separate whole numbers from parts of numbers
eng_sen: One kilogram equals two point two (= 2.2) pounds.
The error occurred when someone left out the decimal point.
chi_sen: 1公斤等於2.2磅。
有人遺漏了小數點，出現了錯誤。

eng_def: the toes of a ballet dancer's shoes
eng_sen: She is learning how to dance on her points.
chi_sen: 她正在學習如何以足尖踮地跳舞。

eng_def: a socket to which a wire from a piece of electrical equipment is connected in order to supply it with electricity or a radio, television, or other signal
eng_sen: a TV antenna point
There is a phone point in every room.
chi_sen: 電視天線插孔
每個房間都有電話線插孔。

eng_def: in some car engines, either of two parts that allow or prevent the flow of electricity
eng_sen: He checked the points and plugs and topped up the oil.
chi_sen: 他檢查了分電器接點和火花塞，加滿了油。

eng_def: a place on a railway track where the rails (= metal bars on which the trains travel) can be moved to allow a train to change from one track to another
eng_sen: The train rattled as it went over the points.
chi_sen: 火車哐啷哐啷駛過道岔。

eng_def: a small, round mark on a line, plan, or map to show the position of something
eng_sen: Join the points A and B together on the diagram with a straight line.
chi_sen: 將圖上的 A 點和 B 點用直線連起來。

eng_def: a very small, round light that you can see in the distance
eng_sen: I could just make out the tiny points of a car's headlights far away.
chi_sen: 我只能勉強看到遠處車前燈的小小光點。

eng_def: to direct other people's attention to something by holding out your finger towards it
eng_sen: "Look at that!" she said, pointing at the hole in the door.
Small children are often told that it's rude to point.
chi_sen: 「看那個！」她指著門上的洞說道。
小孩子們經常被告知用手指指點點是不禮貌的。

eng_def: to hold something out in the direction of someone or something
eng_sen: He said that the man had pointed a knife at him.
chi_sen: 他說那人用刀指著他。

eng_def: If something points in a particular direction, it is turned towards that direction.
eng_sen: The road sign points left.
All the cars were pointing in the same direction.
There was an arrow pointing to the door.
chi_sen: 路標指向左邊。
所有的汽車都朝一個方向開。
有個箭頭指向房門。

eng_def: relating to when a ballet dancer dances on their toes
eng_sen: a pair of point shoes
Today we'll do some point work.
chi_sen: 一雙芭蕾舞足尖鞋
今天我們將做一些足尖練習。

eng_def: behaving in a way that is socially correct and shows understanding of and care for other people's feelings
eng_sen: I'm afraid I wasn't very polite to her.
She sent me a polite letter thanking me for my invitation.
He was too polite to point out my mistake.
chi_sen: 恐怕那時我對她有點不禮貌。
她給我寫了一封客氣的信，感謝我的邀請。
他太客氣，沒有指出我的錯誤。

eng_def: socially correct rather than friendly
eng_sen: polite conversation
chi_sen: 溫文爾雅的談話

eng_def: people who have been taught how to behave in a socially correct way:
chi_def: 過去在上流社會從來不談有關性的問題。
eng_sen: Sex never used to be discussed in polite society.
chi_sen: 過去在上流社會從來不談有關性的問題。
